intro.description: This type of analysis allows you to better examine the quality of data and the relationships between tables by comparing identical columns in different tables or comparing the tables themselves.

item.title: Set the analysis metadata
item.description: To open the Create New Analysis wizard, right click Analyses on the DQ Repository view and select New Analysis. Then expand Cross Table Analysis and select Redundancy Analysis. The wizard prompts you to provide the analysis metadata (name, purpose, description...). Upon completion, an editor opens in which you can modify the analysis metadata and define the analysis settings.

item.title: Select columns for set A
item.description: Click Analyzed Column Sets to open the corresponding view (or click the link below). Then click A Column Set. A dialog box opens in which you can browse to and select the first set of columns.

item.title: Select columns for set B
item.description: Click Analyzed Column Sets to open the corresponding view(or click the link below). Then click B Column Set. A dialog box opens in which you can browse to and select the second set of columns.

item.title: Analyze
item.description: Click the Run icon, located towards the top left of the editor, to execute the analysis. Alternatively, right click the analysis on the DQ Repository tree view and click the Run icon on the list which appears.
